intro: Diosma obtusata, commonly known as the bluntleaf diosma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Diosma obtusata is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
